message.content:
cs.FL, cs.DS, cs.CC, cs.IT, cs.LG. 

The paper deals with the problem of finding the smallest DFA needed to distinguish between two words, which is a fundamental problem in formal language theory (cs.FL). The problem also involves the use of algorithms and data structures to efficiently compute the size of the DFA (cs.DS). The paper discusses the complexity of the problem and considers variations, which are typical topics in computational complexity theory (cs.CC). The authors also use information theory to derive lower bounds on the size of the DFA, which falls under the category of information theory (cs.IT). Finally, the paper presents new results on the problem, which could be of interest to researchers in machine learning and pattern recognition (cs.LG).
